title: [aerospace] High Employee Turnover Risk in Operations
description: The Operations department has the highest number of employees (14), but with a significant number of supervisors (11 under EMP002) indicating potential management issues. This could lead to high turnover rates and operational inefficiencies.
recommendations: Implement retention strategies for Operations staff
business_impact: High turnover can lead to increased training costs and operational disruptions.

title: [aerospace] Concentration Risk in Baggage Handling
description: All baggage handling records show a single bag type (CHECKED) and a single origin (ICN), indicating a lack of diversity in baggage operations which could lead to vulnerabilities if issues arise.
business_impact: Over-reliance on a single source can lead to significant operational disruptions.

title: [aerospace] High Parts Cost in Aircraft Maintenance
description: The average parts cost for aircraft maintenance is $6965, with a maximum of $125,000. This indicates potential inefficiencies in maintenance procurement or unexpected repairs.
recommendations: Review maintenance contracts and supplier agreements
business_impact: High parts costs can significantly impact operational budgets and profitability.

title: [aerospace] Concentration of Employees in Operations
description: The Operations department has the highest number of employees (14), which may indicate over-reliance on this department for critical functions. This could pose risks if there are sudden absences or turnover.
recommendations: Develop a contingency plan for staffing
business_impact: Mitigating risks associated with employee turnover can ensure smoother operations.

title: [aerospace] Limited Airline Diversity
description: The dataset shows a concentration of airlines from specific countries, particularly Korea (10), which may indicate a lack of diversity in partnerships and potential vulnerability to regional disruptions.
recommendations: Expand partnerships with airlines from other regions
Diversify routes to reduce dependency on specific markets
business_impact: Diversifying airline partnerships can mitigate risks associated with geopolitical or economic changes.

title: [aerospace] Employee Shift Pattern Imbalance
description: The majority of employees (50 out of 70) are on a rotational shift pattern, which may lead to fatigue and decreased productivity. This could affect operational efficiency.
recommendations: Evaluate shift patterns for employee well-being
Consider implementing more stable shift schedules
business_impact: Improving employee shift patterns can enhance productivity and reduce turnover rates.
